Mrs. Brolsma was Alexander Warnarka’s 1st grade teacher in 2008-09 at William Budd School, where they discovered they were born on the same day......but a few years apart!
They’ve been exchanging birthday treats for 12 years. Alexander graduates this spring and Mrs B’s birthday will never be the same. She wrote him a Dr. Seuss style poem~

“Stop and listen to this special news,
It doesn’t happen often, to only a few!
A 1st grade teacher and her student one year, Had identical birthdays...and they gave a big cheer!
They celebrated together with balloons and some treats, Oh what a party, it couldn’t be beat!
And year after year, he didn’t missed one, Alexander showed up to share treats and some fun!
And now he’s a Senior and their tradition will end, But Mrs B. has much gratitude for this special young man!
She taught him to smile, to be a “Caring Kid”...
He excelled in those standards..he certainly did!”

Mrs. Meyer's 4th grade students were able to visit Fairmont Elementary's new MakerSpace Lab for a pilot lesson. Mrs. Duehlmeyer invited them into the MakerSpace to teach them how to apply their coding skills to a little robot called Ozobot.

Day 1, after learning the expectations for the new Makerspace, they were able to tinker with the robots and code them. Some of the objectives of this lesson were to collaborate and cooperate with a partner as well as learn through hands-on exploring. When Mrs. Meyer's class came back for Day 2, they were then to expand their knowledge from day 1 by creating a path that their Ozobot had to complete. The students had to figure out how to code their bot for the right distance and ability to turn when needed. There was a lot of testing and recoding as well as some celebrating when they finally figured it out!

Lily plans to obtain a degree in the field of medicine.
